alert.note: Alert for Chambers; Coosa; Elmore; Lee; Macon; Montgomery; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 2:48PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Lee, eastern Elmore, northwestern Macon, Tallapoosa, northwestern Chambers, northeastern Montgomery and southeastern Coosa Counties through 330 PM CST... At 248 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wind Creek State Park to Montgomery. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Alexander City, Tuskegee, Wetumpka, Tallassee, Dadeville, Camp Hill, Notasulga, Equality, Milstead, Eclectic, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Shorter, Franklin, Martin Dam, Santuck, Auburn University In Montgomery, Waugh and Dexter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chambers; Coosa; Elmore; Lee; Macon; Montgomery; Tallapoosa
